items.title: Fujiyama Power Systems shares make weak debut, list at 4% descount to IPO price
items.description: Fujiyama Power Systems shares debuted on Dalal Street with a discount. The solar solutions company's IPO saw moderate interest. Fujiyama manufactures and sells a wide range of rooftop solar products. The company has a strong distribution network. Financials show robust growth. Analysts believe the issue is fully priced. Much will depend on market conditions.

items.title: Barclays lifts S&P 500 target to 7,400 on megacap tech strength
items.description: Barclays has lifted its forecast for the S&P 500, projecting that the index will reach 7,400 by the end of 2026. This represents an expected gain of 11.4% from Wednesday’s close, reflecting the bank’s confidence in the market’s forward momentum. (Source: Reuters)

items.title: The forgotten Tata stock: Will investors ever recover Rs 25,000 crore loss that keeps getting bigger?
items.description: Tata Technologies, once a dream listing, has seen its market value plummet by Rs 25,000 crore from its peak.  Revenue concentration on Tata Motors and JLR, coupled with their challenges, has led to uneven financial performance and cautious brokerage sentiment. Investors face a long road to recovery as the stock struggles to regain its footing.

items.title: Groww shares fall 18% in 2 days. What’s triggering the fall in Billionbrains?
items.description: Groww shares experienced a significant decline, dropping as much as 9% to Rs 154 on Thursday. This profit-booking follows a substantial post-listing surge, with the stock now down 18% in two sessions amid concerns over stretched valuations and continued short-selling.

items.title: No Rivalry? Pakistan may be getting hammered in cricket, but it's beating India in stock market returns
items.description: Pakistan's stock market has surged over 40% this year, outperforming India's relatively subdued 9% return. This rally is driven by retail investors shifting to equities amid low returns elsewhere and improved economic sentiment, with two ratings agencies upgrading the country. Indian markets faced headwinds from foreign investor outflows due to developed market performance and currency concerns, alongside slower earnings growth.

items.title: Buy, Sell or Hold: ICICI Securities maintains Hold on NSDL; Motilal Oswal maintains buy on L&T
items.description: Brokerages express optimism for select large-cap stocks, citing strong execution and growth potential. ICICI Securities maintains a 'Hold' on NSDL, anticipating market-share gains. Motilal Oswal reiterates 'Buy' ratings on L&T and Reliance Industries, highlighting L&T's order inflow visibility and RIL's New Energy advancements, including its battery GIGA factory.

items.title: Sensex jumps 150 pts, Nifty tops 26,000 as foreign inflows, Nvidia-fuelled rally lift mood
items.description: Indian stocks opened higher on Thursday, with the Sensex and Nifty gaining ground. This rise was fueled by a fresh surge in foreign investment and a positive risk sentiment across Asian markets. Nvidia's strong earnings report significantly boosted global tech shares, contributing to the optimistic trading environment.

items.title: L&T Technology Services among 4 stocks flashing bullish signals, hinting at a possible uptrend
items.description: On November 19, in the NSE midcap pack, four stocks came to the bullish scanner of "White Marubozu", according to stockedge.com's technical scan data. A White Marubozu is a bullish candlestick pattern in technical analysis. It occurs when the opening price is the lowest for a given period, and the closing price is the highest.Represented by a long white (or green) candlestick with no upper shadow and a small or nonexistent lower shadow, it indicates strong buying pressure throughout the session. Traders interpret it as a signal that buyers were in control from the opening to the closing, often using such patterns for informed decisions about future price movements in financial markets."

items.title: Japan's Nikkei up 4% after bumper Nvidia results
items.description: Japanese markets surged today, with the Nikkei climbing four percent, fueled by Nvidia's stellar earnings and booming AI chip demand.  The tech giant's "off the charts" sales of its latest hardware eased worries about overvalued tech stocks.  A weaker yen also boosted export-oriented companies, contributing to the positive sentiment.

items.title: Infosys, Max Healthcare among 6 Nifty stocks showing bullish RSI upswing
items.description: On November 19, in the Nifty50 pack, six stocks were highlighted in the RSI Trending Up scan, based on data from stockedge.com. It is an uptrend signal if the RSI value has crossed above 50 from below. "RSI trending up" indicates that the Relative Strength Index (RSI) values are increasing, suggesting a strengthening momentum in the stock's price. This can indicate potential upward movement and may be used by traders to identify opportunities for buying.

items.title: Infosys share buyback begins: Should you participate in Rs 18,000 crore offer at 17% premium?
items.description: Infosys' Rs 18,000 crore share buyback, offering a 17% premium, opened today, closing November 26. Experts see it as a psychological floor for long-term investors and a profit-booking opportunity, signaling management confidence amid uncertain IT demand. While providing modest financial metric boosts, its impact is incremental, not transformative.

items.title: Nvidia’s blowout earnings ignite global tech stocks. What it means for D-Street investors
items.description: Nvidia’s stunning quarterly performance sent a wave of relief through global markets. Analysts said the chipmaker’s powerful guidance restored confidence in the broader AI ecosystem, even as they warned that sentiment could reverse if future growth fails to keep pace. Indian equities, buoyed by IT strength and an upcoming Rs 18,000 crore Infosys buyback, are expected to mirror the global rebound as investors position for a tech-driven session on Dalal Street.

items.title: Sula Vineyards shares fall over 1% as ICRA revises outlook to negative
items.description: Sula Vineyards’ opened in the red after ICRA revised its outlook to negative while reaffirming key ratings. The company posted weaker Q2 results, with profit, revenue and margins declining. Management attributed the softness to Telangana market disruptions but expects H2 improvement, supported by better margins, wine tourism growth and easing inventory pressures.

items.title: Q2 earnings shows Rs 4 lakh crore-crisis may deepen in stock market's riskier corners
items.description: Recent Q2 earnings reveal a troubling trend in India's stock market. Smallcap companies are experiencing the highest number of earnings misses, leading to a substantial Rs 4 lakh crore loss in market value this year. While mid-caps and large-caps show positive growth, the riskier smallcap segment faces continued weakness.

items.title: Vikram Solar shares in spotlight as 3-month lock-in ends today; 93 lakh shares available to trade
items.description: Vikram Solar’s three-month shareholder lock-in ends today, making 93 lakh shares worth Rs 275.7 crore eligible for trade. The newly listed firm, which debuted at Rs 340, is expanding aggressively across modules, cells and BESS, and recently posted sharp profit growth, though the stock remains 27% below its post-listing high.

items.title: Barclays raises target, estimates 11% gain for S&P 500 by end-2026
items.description: Barclays strategists have boosted their S&P 500 year-end 2026 target to 7,400, anticipating an 11.4% rise driven by megacap tech strength and a supportive monetary and fiscal outlook. They foresee faster tech earnings growth, though acknowledge potential headwinds for other sectors due to inflation and unemployment.

items.title: Anil Ambani’s Reliance Power shares rise 5%, snap 3-day fall. What’s behind the surge?
items.description: Reliance Power shares rose sharply after the company announced a major governance overhaul and key clean-energy milestones. The board approved a new Board of Management to strengthen oversight, while subsidiary Reliance NU Energies secured 4 GW solar and 6.5 GW BESS capacity.

items.title: Swiggy back to square one as stock sinks 56% from peak, returns to IPO price. What's ahead?
items.description: Swiggy's stock has fallen 56% from its peak, returning to its IPO price of Rs 390. Despite a 54% revenue jump, the company's net loss widened to Rs 1,092 crore in Q2FY26, primarily due to quick commerce expansion. Brokerages remain divided on its future prospects.

items.title: QT ends sooner than expected as Fed prioritizes market calm
items.description: The Federal Reserve’s October meeting minutes show that “almost all” policymakers supported stopping the balance-sheet drawdown from 1 December. The early halt surprised markets, as expectations had pointed to a much later end. Only one member dissented, preferring an immediate stop. (Source: Reuters)

items.title: JP Power shares rally nearly 30% in two days after Adani Group wins creditor nod for JP Associates acquisition
items.description: JP Power News: Jaiprakash Power Ventures surged nearly 30% in two sessions after the Adani Group secured Committee of Creditors approval to acquire Jaiprakash Associates. The $1.5-billion deal marks a major step in the Jaypee Group’s insolvency process. Adani Enterprises received a Letter of Intent (LoI) from the Resolution Professional on November 19, 2025.

items.title: Nvidia’s AI Tipping Point: Boom or Bubble?
items.description: Huang argues the world is at a tipping point, not a bubble. He believes Nvidia-style accelerated computing will permeate everything—from writing software to running real-world robots. (Source: Reuters)
